result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles T Blandin

defendant.name: Blandin, Charles T
defendant.address: 101 E Mifflin St Apt 218, Madison, WI 53703

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on February 17, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
11:57 AM Defendant Charles T Blandin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn has new case, IA is 11/3. Case to track.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Sheena S except only for the purposes of arranging child custody or placement and incidental contact.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Nicholas E except for incidental contact.
- Defendant shall not be in the 1800 block of Helene Pkwy in Madison except only as necessary for child custody or placement. 
Trial Judge - Br 12
Status conference on October 7, 2022 at 11:45 am.

8:57 AM Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles T Blandin in court. CT has colloquy w/ Defn about right to waive atty. Defn waives right to atty. CT accepts as knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily. Argument by Defn. State objects, argument by State. CT amends "Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Sheena S except only for the purposes of arranging child custody or placement." TO "Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Sheena S except only for the purposes of arranging child custody or placement and incidental contact." CT amends "Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Nicholas E." TO "Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Nicholas E except for incidental contact." ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.
Bail/bond hearing on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from Defn re: no contact bond conditions
Status conference on October 7, 2022 at 11:45 am.
10:17 AM Defendant appeared.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn waiving right to atty, will be filing a bond motion. CT to set BBH, address verified.
Status conference on July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Sheena S except only for the purposes of arranging child custody or placement. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Nicholas E. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 1800 block of Helene Pkwy in Madison except only as necessary for child custody or placement. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

02:46 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
